rows.title: Importance of Social Support
rows.content_1: When girls and women have access to safe and affordable sanitary materials to manage their menstruation, they decrease their risk of infections from unproper mentral practices. As a result, there may be a positive impact on sexual and reproductive health overall, including a decline in teen pregnancy, positive mother outcomes, and fertility.

rows.title: Menstrual tips.
rows.content_1:
* Dispose of sanitary pads properly.
Sanitary pads must never be flushed down the toilet since they could clog the drainage system and cause an overflow instead you should wrap it with a newspaper or toilet paper and dispose of it in the biohazard bin or a latrine after use.
* Changing the sanitary pad regularly to keep a good hygiene during
the period time.
A tampon should not be worn for more than 8 hours.
* Wash yourself properly from front to back and clean the
undergarments to avoid reproductive and urinary tract infections
which can result in future infertility and birth complications.
* Wash your hands after disposing of the use pad. 
Neglecting to wash hands after changing menstrual products can
spread infections, such as hepatitis B and thrush.
*Light exercise can improve mental, physical, and menstrual health. Through guided dynamic stretching, you assist reduce stress and increase blood flow, which will lessen the severity of period cramps and pain.
